meanings.sent1: The jacqueries in the village were a response to the unfair treatment of the peasants.
meanings.sent2: The history books are filled with tales of jacqueries throughout the centuries.
meanings.sent3: The jacqueries in the story led to a surprising twist in the plot.
meanings.sent4: The jacqueries of the past echoed in the minds of the ruling class.
meanings.sent5: The vivid descriptions of the jacqueries painted a picture of chaos and defiance.

meanings.definition: Acts of violence or unrest by peasants.
meanings.sent1: The jacqueries resulted in damage to the fields and homes of the landlords.
meanings.sent2: The authorities were quick to respond to any signs of jacqueries in the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The jacqueries were a last resort for the desperate peasants.
meanings.sent4: The jacqueries shook the foundations of the established order.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the jacqueries lingered in the minds of the villagers for years to come.

meanings.sent1: The jacqueries were a bold statement against the oppressive landowners.
meanings.sent2: The leaders of the jacqueries were seen as heroes by the common folk.
meanings.sent3: The jacqueries were a thorn in the side of the ruling elite.
meanings.sent4: The jacqueries symbolized the resilience of the rural workers.
meanings.sent5: The jacqueries were a testament to the power of unity among the downtrodden.
